<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 293]]<|/det|>
0606/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 267, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Non- calculator  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 326, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 805, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- Calculators must not be used in this paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 212, 601]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 75, 570, 90]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 107, 784, 125]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\). \((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 155, 675, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 203, 685, 221]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 247, 683, 275]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 295, 685, 323]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 350, 660, 368]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation For the equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 368, 563, 402]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 447, 228, 463]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 437, 910, 480]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^n = a^n + \binom{n}{1} a^{n-1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n-2}b^2 + \dots + \binom{n}{r} a^{n-r}b^r + \dots + b^n,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 484, 774, 526]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!r!}\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 555, 220, 570]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 553, 670, 600]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = a + (n-1)d \\ S_n = \frac{1}{2}n(a+l) = \frac{1}{2}n\{2a+(n-1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 632, 220, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 630, 575, 710]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = ar^{n-1} \\ S_n = \frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} \quad (r \neq 1) \\ S_\infty = \frac{a}{1-r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 743, 161, 757]]<|/det|>
Identities 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 740, 560, 789]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A = 1 \\ \sec^2 A = 1 + \tan^2 A \\ \cosec^2 A = 1 + \cot^2 A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 830, 243, 845]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\) 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 827, 580, 900]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \\ a^2 = b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A \\ \Delta = \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[332, 72, 665, 88]]<|/det|>
Calculators must **not** be used in this paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 103, 94, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 144, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 120, 797, 444]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 464, 863, 482]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = (2x + a)(x + b)(x + c)\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 495, 363, 513]]<|/det|>
Find values for \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 513]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 713, 146, 731]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 713, 586, 731]]<|/det|>
Use the graph to find the values of \(x\) for which \(y \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 713, 920, 731]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 75, 792, 95]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \(\ x^{2} + 4kx + k + 3 = 0\\) has two equal roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 370, 92, 390]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 370, 688, 387]]<|/det|>
The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + Ax + 30\) , where \(A\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 386, 510, 403]]<|/det|>
When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 2\) the remainder is 84.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 418, 437, 435]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 418, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 546, 90]]<|/det|>
Solutions by accurate drawing will not be accepted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 103, 536, 122]]<|/det|>
A circle, \(C,\) has equation \(\left(x - 5\right)^{2} + \left(y - 12\right)^{2} = 100\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 598, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to \(C\) at the point \((11, 4)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 151, 720, 168]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(ax + by = c\) , where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 523, 148, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 523, 719, 540]]<|/det|>
Show that \(C\) and the circle with equation \(\quad x^{2} + y^{2} = 4\) do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 523, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 702, 90]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the following curves.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 98, 625, 131]]<|/det|>
\[y = 4\ln x\quad \mathrm{and}\quad y = 5 - \frac{3}{\ln(x^2)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 378, 151]]<|/det|>
Give your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 698, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 298, 561, 326]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{3}{x + 1} - \frac{x - 2}{x}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 333, 905, 352]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<mark>[1]

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 489, 780, 508]]<|/det|>
Show that the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(AB\) and the curve is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 508, 540, 536]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{4} -\ln \frac{b}{2}~, \text{where}~a~\text{and}~b~\text{are integers to be found.}\]

<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 651, 95]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x) = -2x^{2} + 9x - 10\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 108, 146, 126]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 108, 180, 126]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 108, 715, 127]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a + b(x + c)^2\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 108, 920, 127]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 386, 534, 405]]<|/det|>
Hence determine whether or not \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 692, 92]]<|/det|>
The function \(\mathrm{g}\) is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = 3\ln (5 - 2x)\) for \(0\leqslant x< 2.5\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 180, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 104, 536, 122]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 120, 918, 153]]<|/det|>
State the exact values of the intercepts with the coordinate axes and the equation of any asymptote. [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 176, 739, 524]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 558, 180, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 558, 432, 575]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 740, 465, 759]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 757, 515, 774]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 106, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 85, 440, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 343, 485, 360]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four points, \(O, A, B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 368, 581, 395]]<|/det|>
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie in a straight line and are such that \(\frac{AB}{AC} = \frac{1}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 402, 290, 420]]<|/det|>
\(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 435, 144, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 435, 388, 453]]<|/det|>
Find \(\overrightarrow{OC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 452, 332, 467]]<|/det|>
Simplify your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 452, 918, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 673, 88]]<|/det|>
The line \(OA\) is extended to the point \(D\) such that \(\text{OA} : \text{AD} = 2 : 7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 93, 463, 109]]<|/det|>
Point \(E\) lies on \(CD\) such that \(\overrightarrow{OE} = \lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 123, 312, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 678, 90]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line and passes through a fixed point \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 87, 621, 106]]<|/det|>
At time \(t\) seconds, its displacement from \(O, s\) metres, is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 115, 576, 136]]<|/det|>
\[s = t + 6t^{2} - t^{3}\qquad \mathrm{for} 0\leqslant t\leqslant 3\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 144, 777, 171]]<|/det|>
\[s = 12t - \frac{1}{3} t^2 - 3\qquad \mathrm{for} 3\leqslant t\leqslant k\qquad \mathrm{where} k\mathrm{~is~a~constant.}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 179, 814, 198]]<|/det|>
It is given that, for \(3 \leqslant t \leqslant k\), the velocity of \(P\) is positive and its acceleration is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 211, 146, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 211, 534, 229]]<|/det|>
The maximum velocity of \(P\) occurs when \(t = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 225, 858, 244]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch a velocity–time graph for the first \(k\) seconds of the motion of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 244]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[259, 256, 737, 540]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 620, 90]]<|/det|>
The total distance travelled by \(P\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant k\) is 57 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 918, 121]]<|/det|>
Given that when \(t = 3\) the distance and displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) are equal, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 122, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[334, 895, 663, 911]]<|/det|>
<pre>Question 12 is printed on the next page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 104, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 77, 851, 107]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = \frac{4}{x^2} + ax + 7\) at the point where \(x = 2\) has equation \(x + 4y = b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 112, 327, 129]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
